passage_text: 1 You can also spice things up by choosing a shoe with a little bit of sparkle on it. 2  Satin shoes are almost always appropriate for gala events. 3  Do not wear any shoe with a wedge, cork or wood in its design, nor is it usually appropriate to wear any form of boot.

Tuxedo. The invitation may indicate that the gala event is a black tie affair. This indicates you are expected to wear a tuxedo. If the invitation does not specifically state black tie, a gala event in the evening suggests that a tuxedo should be worn. Most men don't wear a tuxedo often, so you may not own one.

Stoles, shawls and wraps are a common and necessary addition to your wintertime gala wear. Remember to choose something that adds to your outfit rather than takes away from it. For men, winter galas mean dark colors and heavy weight suit fabric. In summer, gala events are often outdoors.

Best Answer: Most people are often confused at the type of gala dress to wear while attending a gala event. I will try and break it down for you… First of all you will need to find out the gala theme. There are numerous themes including fire & ice, royal, masquerades, and many others.

Dressing for a gala event is rather simple. It is typically a formal wear occasion. For men, that equates to a tuxedo or at the very least a suit and tie. For women, formal wear is typically a long gown with high heels, matching accessories and jewelry.

A gala is a formal party. Usually the dress code for a gala is black tie. On some ultra formal galas the dress code can also be white tie but in these cases it is written on the invitation. Click here for information on what to wear to a gala if the required dress code is white tie.
Those attending a gala dinner may have to wear white tie, black tie, black tie optional, semi-formal or creative black tie attire.
A: Those attending a gala dinner may have to wear white tie, black tie, black tie optional, semi-formal or creative black tie attire. The dress code is generally listed on the invitation.
